Question:
Choose the most appropriate ANTONYM for the underlined word in the given sentence.
The war was followed by a long period of prosperity.

Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given phrase.
An important person who represents his/her country in a foreign country

Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Martha made pancakes yesterday.
OP1: Pancakes had been made by Martha yesterday.
OP2: Pancakes were being made by Martha yesterday.
OP3: Pancakes were made by Martha yesterday.
OP4: Pancakes was made by Martha yesterday.

Question:
In the given question, a statement divided into different segments is given. Rearrange all the segments to form a coherent
statement.
O: also benefit from knowing
P: there are several reasons
Q: why even parents would
R: more about how and why
S: children do the things that they do

Select the most appropriate meaning of the given idiom.
Radhika stood by Monica's side through thick and thin.
OP1: Under easy situations wherein she could ensure Monica's safety and security
OP2: In all the happy moments, personally spending most of her time
OP3: Under all conditions, no matter how challenging or difficult
OP4: In the moments when Monica couldn't complete some simple tasks

Question:
Give one word substitution for :
A person who is unsure about God’s existence

Select the most appropriate synonym of the underlined word in the given sentence.
His approach was filled with such perseverance that it was difficult to overlook his merit.

Select the most appropriate option that can substitute the underlined part in the following sentence.
Everyone called the reporter a daredevil after he came back safely from the war zone.

Parts of the given sentence have been underlined. Identify the part that has an error. Select 'No error' if there is no error.
Although the team had trained diligently for months, they had still overwhelmed by the opponent's unexpected tactics.

Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the underlined word.
If someone babbles, it means that they talk in a confused or excited way.

Select the most appropriate ANTONYM of the word in the brackets to fill in the blank.
Akash went to ______ his school uniform. [sell]

Select the most appropriate option to substitute the underlined word segment in the given sentence.
Carnatic music is usually performed by a small troupe of actors, consisting of a principal performer, a melodic accompaniment, and a rhythm accompaniment.

Select the option that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.
One who speaks less in a forum.

Parts of a sentence are given below in jumbled order. Select the option that gives their correct logical sequence and forms a meaningful sentence.
In November, Lakshman fell (P) / with fever (Q) / seriously ill (R) and pneumonia (S).

In the following sentence, four words are underlined out of which one word is misspelt. Identify the INCORRECTLY spelt word.
I felt absolutely (A) fit at the summit. My mind was absolutely clear.(B) I didn’t feel tired, I felt exhilerated. (C)It was a very clear sensation.(D)

The following sentence has been divided into five segments. The first segment has no error. Select the option that has the segment with the grammatical error.
Due to the pandemic, / the prices of / medicines increased / every day since / last December.

Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.
I will be gifted a fancy doll by them the next day.
OP1: They gifted me a fancy doll yesterday.
OP2: They are gifting me a fancy doll the next day.
OP3: They gift me a fancy doll the previous day.
OP4: They will gift me a fancy doll tomorrow.

Question:
Select the most appropriate option that can rectify the incorrectly spelt word in the following sentence.
The government has ordered for the maintainance of the roads.

Select the most appropriate meaning of the given word.
illiterate
OP3: A person who cannot read and write

Question:

Affirmative
